channel.title: Need portforwarding help with teamviewer
channel.description:
i need some help with portforwarding, i already have a static IP: 77.165.89.36 i was almost sure i did it right, but now suddenly canyouseeme.org says: Error i also need some some help getting my source and client to run via that IP and port: 43594 i use the base: Exion [PI] so if you want to help me, please reply to this topic :) i hope i gave enough information
oh yeah and router: KPN experiabox ARV7519
i did work on the server, i made it a Quinten production like 70% was mine, but i fucked up (forgot to make back-up) and now the server is 100% exion i just want to make sure it can be played, then i will make it 70% Quinten again and then release it

item.title: Need portforwarding help with teamviewer
item.dc:creator: @SheaTheDude SheaTheDude
item.description:
@SheaTheDude wrote:

Basically it means that the modem will block some ports to come through, no matter how many times you portforward because it’s easy to get a virus through gaming ports…

Read full topic

item.title: Need portforwarding help with teamviewer
item.dc:creator: @quintensky quintensky
item.description:
@quintensky wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:2, topic:432872”]So you have done the following:

[ul][li]Added firewall exceptions OR disabled your computer firewall entirely[/li]
[li]Properly port forwarded - I highly recommend using this site: http://portforward.com[/li]
[li]Also, this is rare, but some ISP give modems that are set to bridge and PPPoE and this WILL interfere if you are also using a router. - To fix this you will need to call your ISP and ask them to set your modem to where it is only bridged.[/li]
[li]You have a static IP, but it is still recommended that you use: http://no-ip.com[/li][/ul]

This is all I can really do for you, but if you need any further help and you can be somewhat vague of what the problem is, feel free to ask.[/quote]

i have done all of that except the third, i didn’t understand a word you said

Read full topic

item.title: Need portforwarding help with teamviewer
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

So you have done the following:

[ul][li]Added firewall exceptions OR disabled your computer firewall entirely[/li]
[li]Properly port forwarded - I highly recommend using this site: http://portforward.com[/li]
[li]Also, this is rare, but some ISP give modems that are set to bridge and PPPoE and this WILL interfere if you are also using a router. - To fix this you will need to call your ISP and ask them to set your modem to where it is only bridged.[/li]
[li]You have a static IP, but it is still recommended that you use: http://no-ip.com[/li][/ul]

This is all I can really do for you, but if you need any further help and you can be somewhat vague of what the problem is, feel free to ask.

Read full topic
